event.title: <show-title>Friendship</show-title> <event-type-title>Early Access + Pre-Recorded Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: See Tim Robinson & Paul Rudd's new comedy first with exclusive bonus content
event.description:
Be among the first to see A24's Tim Robinson & Paul Rudd comedy FRIENDSHIP before it hits theaters. This screening will also exclusively feature a pre-recorded night vision Q&A with Tim Robinson, Paul Rudd, Eric Rahill, and filmmaker Andrew DeYoung: "Men Talking in the Dark."

Suburban dad Craig (Tim Robinson) falls hard for his charismatic new neighbor (Paul Rudd), but Craig’s attempts to make an adult male friend threaten to ruin both of their lives. Brace yourself for wonderful awkwardness.

eventType.title: Fan Event

eventType.description: We’ve teamed up with our studio pals to make sure you and hundreds of other superfans are the first to see the opening night of a major cinematic event.

show.title: Heartworn Highways
show.headline: The best music and the best whiskey come from the same part of the country

show.title: Crossroads (2002)
show.headline: Britney Spears' coming-of-age movie

event.title: <show-title>Crossroads (2002)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Britney Spears' coming-of-age movie
event.description:
CROSSROADS tells the story of three childhood friends, Lucy (Britney Spears), Kit (Zoë Saldana), and Mimi (Taryn Manning), who, after eight years apart, rediscover their friendship on a cross-country trip. With barely a plan, practically no money but plenty of dreams, the girls catch a lift with Mimi's handsome friend Ben (Anson Mount) in his convertible. Along the way, they not only gather experiences that will change their lives, but they also discover how important it is to hold onto their hearts' desires.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Globe keychain
  • Feather earrings
  • Butterfly kerchief
  • Road trip map

Along the way, they not only gather experiences that will change their lives, but they also discover how important it is to hold onto their hearts' desires.

show.title: Shrek
show.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told

event.title: <show-title>Shrek</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: The greatest fairy tale never told
event.description:
When a green ogre called Shrek discovers his swamp has been "swamped" with all sorts of fairytale creatures by the scheming Lord Farquaad, Shrek sets out, with a very loud donkey by his side, to persuade Farquaad to give his swamp back. Instead, a deal is made. Farquaad, who wants to become the king, sends Shrek to rescue Princess Fiona, who is waiting for her one true love. But once they head back with Fiona, it starts to become apparent that not only does Shrek like Fiona, but Fiona is keeping something secret.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Ogre ears
  • Onion keychain
  • Eye-pop bird
  • Smell-along card

show.title: Jaws (1975)
show.headline: Steven Spielberg's terrifying creature feature

event.title: <show-title>Jaws (1975)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A bigger boatload of bite-y fun
event.description:
“This shark, swallow you whole.”

Duh, nuh…duh, nuh…nothing quite says "ah, summer" like watching an elusive giant shark terrorize Amity Island on the big screen. It’s the movie that perfected the summer blockbuster and launched a million toothy (and goofy) knock-offs, but none of them can compete with the bite of Spielberg’s 1975 original. This bona fide American classic has everything you could want from a movie: kids in peril, drunken sea shanties, and Richard Dreyfuss in a cage.

As if that wasn’t enough, this is a Movie Party, so you can live the shark-hunting adventure along with your pals Brody, Hooper, and Quint – minus the salty sea air and actual mortal peril. Featuring shark hats, yellow floatie drink holders (CAUTION: very susceptible to shark attacks), and a boat-shaped bath bomb with a great white shark in the center, it’s the most fourth-wall-busting fun you can have on dry land.

show.title: Dogma
show.headline: Faith is a funny thing

event.title: <show-title>Dogma</show-title> <event-type-title>Resurrected! 25th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: New 4K remaster including exclusive bonus content
event.description: DOGMA is a satirical fantasy comedy that follows two fallen angels, Bartleby and Loki, who discover a loophole that would allow them to return to Heaven, which would inadvertently undo the creation of the universe. A woman named Bethany, who is struggling with her faith, is tasked with stopping them before their plan succeeds. Along the way, she is joined by various characters, including a muse, a seraphim, and a group of unlikely allies, all as they battle against the forces of heaven and hell. Directed by Kevin Smith, the film combines dark humor, theological questions, and absurdity to explore topics of faith, redemption, and religious mythology. After 25 years off the market, DOGMA serves to be a cult classic with fans, and this new 4K remaster also includes exclusive bonus content only available in theatres.

show.title: Wolf Children (Subtitled)
show.headline: After her werewolf lover dies, a woman must find a way to raise their children

event.title: <show-title>Wolf Children (Subtitled)</show-title> <event-type-title>in 4K</event-type-title>
event.headline: After her werewolf lover dies, a woman must find a way to raise their children
event.description:
Presented in Japanese with English subtitles

College student Hana falls in love with a “wolf man,” and together they have two half-human, half-wolf children, Ame and Yuki. The young family’s happy but humble life comes to an abrupt end when the father is tragically killed during a hunt. After struggling to raise her children in the busy city, Hana boldly decides to move to a dilapidated house in the countryside in hopes that her children may one day decide their own path to happiness – whether “human” or “wolf.”

This heart-wrenching modern fairy tale is a staggering work of beauty and emotion from Academy Award®-nominated director Mamoru Hosoda. Rich with gorgeous animation and set to a poignant musical score, WOLF CHILDREN is a sweeping tale about self-discovery and the bonds of family.

show.title: Mermaids
show.headline: Here's a real mother for you!

event.title: <show-title>Mermaids</show-title>
event.headline: As always, Cher is Mother!
event.description:
“Please, God, don't let me fall in love and want to do disgusting things.”

Bildungsroman! Excuse me. I didn’t mean to shout – that’s just how that word comes flying out of me. We know the classic coming-of-age narrative well. It’s a staple of film and literature. GREAT EXPECTATIONS. STAND BY ME. ALMOST FAMOUS. We get it. In Richard Benjamin and June Roberts’ adaptation of Patty Dann’s novel Mermaids, Winona Ryder comes of age for the...I don’t know, fourth or fifth time? Ryder stayed coming-of-age in her early career! Picture it: 1963. Sicily. Massachusetts. Neurotic and chaotically uptight teenager Charlotte Flax (Ryder) has just moved to Eastport with her quirky, water-fixated sister Kate (Christina Ricci) and her brassy mother, Rachel (IT'S CHER!). Charlotte rejects her mother’s freewheeling and sexually audacious lifestyle, preferring to pursue a chaste path of piety. But our desires and fixations often get the better of us and can lead to anxiety and self-doubt, especially when we have the sneaking suspicion that we may, in fact, be other. What we want can run counter to what we want to want, if that makes any sense. Charlotte’s pray-the-lust-away antics and Cher’s dragged up styling provide MERMAIDS with plenty of queer-coded gems for the mining. Add Bob Hoskins serving his patented brand of daddy to the mix and a poppin' soundtrack of early '60s bops and we’ve got a truly classic film ready for the Queer Film Theory 101 treatment. Sing it, Cher! Does he love me? I wanna know. How can I tell if he loves me so?

show.title: The Brides of Dracula (1960)
show.headline: Peter Cushing's Van Helsing brings the Hammer.

event.title: <show-title>The Brides of Dracula (1960)</show-title>
event.headline: Peter Cushing's Van Helsing brings the Hammer.
event.description:
Marianne (Yvonne Monlaur), a beautiful young girl, is stranded en route to a teaching assignment in Eastern Europe. She is persuaded to spend the night at the nearly deserted castle of the mysterious Baroness Meinster (Martita Hunt). In the castle, Marianne accidentally discovers a man chained to the wall in his room. The Baroness explains only that he is her "sick and feeble-minded" son. Unable to get any further information from her or the maid, Marianne steals a key and sets him free. But once unbound, the man – Baron Meinster (David Peel) – fiendishly recruits the undead for his evil purposes while Marianne and Dr. Van Helsing (Peter Cushing) try to stop him in this classic Hammer Film. (Shout! Factory)

SF: 35mm print courtesy of Universal Pictures

show.title: The Vourdalak
show.headline: Take a bite outta life!

event.title: <show-title>The Vourdalak</show-title>
event.headline: Take a bite outta life!
event.description:
Presented in French with English subtitles

When the Marquis d’Urfé, a noble emissary of the King of France, is attacked and abandoned in the remote countryside, he finds refuge at an eerie, isolated manor. The resident family, reluctant to take him in, exhibits strange behavior as they await the imminent return of their father, Gorcha. But what begins simply as strange quickly devolves into a full fledged nightmare when Gorcha returns, seemingly no longer himself…

Adapted from a novella that predates Bram Stoker’s Dracula by over half a century, THE VOURDALAK is an atmospheric, unexpected, sensorial experience that will leave you reeling and giddy in equal measure.

DCP courtesy of Oscilloscope Laboratories

show.title: Crimes of the Future (2022)
show.headline: David Cronenberg's long-gestating vision of the future of humanity

posterImages.altText: Crimes of the future sp poster

event.title: <show-title>Crimes of the Future (2022)</show-title>
event.headline: David Cronenberg's latest new flesh.
event.description:
Canadian director and beloved weirdo David Cronenberg always has something to say. He may add sexual organs to abdomens and create new gynecological tools, however in addition to being delightfully gross, they all come with a purpose. CRIMES OF THE FUTURE is his scathing and uncomfortable look at the art world, and just what he thinks they take too seriously. In the near-ish future, artists use their bodies as their medium for creation, and the public worships them for this indulgence. Not a classic body-horror, but also not for the squeamish. (Dede Crimmins)

DCP courtesy of NEON

show.title: Female Perversions
show.headline: Tilda cuts loose in this newly restored erotic drama.

event.title: <show-title>Female Perversions</show-title>
event.headline: Tilda cuts loose in this newly restored erotic drama.
event.description:
Eve Stephens (Tilda Swinton), an ambitious and successful trial lawyer in Los Angeles, is up for appointment as a judge while juggling her proclivity for meaningless sex and her relationship with her kleptomaniac sister Madelyn (Amy Madigan). As she navigates intimate relationships with both male and female partners, including geologist John (Clancy Brown) and psychiatrist Renee (Karen Sillas), Eve finds fantasy and reality converging, leading to a tense climax that will decide her personal and professional fate.

A contender for the Grand Jury Prize at the 1996 Sundance Film Festival, FEMALE PERVERSIONS marks the feature film debut of director and co-writer Susan Streitfeld as well as the American film debut of Tilda Swinton. Based on the 1991 psychology text Female Perversions: The Temptations of Emma Bovary by Louise J. Kaplan, Streitfeld’s film is an inspired amalgamation of erotic drama and psychological thriller set within the cutthroat environs of the Los Angeles justice system. (Vinegar Syndrome)

4k Restoration by Vinegar Syndrome/Cinématographe
A Hope Runs High Release

show.title: The Mystery of Chess Boxing
show.headline: Some say that the game of chess is like a sword fight

event.title: <show-title>The Mystery of Chess Boxing</show-title>
event.headline: Some say that the game of chess is like a sword fight
event.description:
The original Ghostface Killer is on the loose! A vicious villain with an unstoppable five element technique, Ghostface is killing off all his old rivals. Meanwhile, a young student tries to learn kung fu and is taken under the wing of an old chess master. The basics of chess prove to be the same as the basics of fighting, and eventually the heroes will have to fight Ghostface Killer, who verbally insults his opponents as he annihilates them. A true classic, and obvious favorite of the Wu Tang Clan, directed by Joseph Kuo (SEVEN GRANDMASTERS). (Hollywood Theatre)

A brand new DCP of the 1979 old school kung fu classic, sourced from the only known 35mm print!

show.title: Triple Fisher: The Lethal Lolitas of Long Island
show.headline: Drew Barrymore, Alyssa Milano, and Noelle Parker are Amy Fisher.

event.title: <show-title>Triple Fisher: The Lethal Lolitas of Long Island</show-title>
event.headline: It's once, twice, three times an Amy
event.description:
“Unspools like a Lifetime movie fever dream, reaching a frenzied schizo climax that would make Brian De Palma proud.” — Andrew Miller, VIDEOLOGY

In 1992, Long Island teenager Amy Fisher ignited a media firestorm when she shot the wife of her lover, Joey Buttafuoco, in the face. This sordid tale of sex, aggravated assault, and Zubaz managed to spawn not one, not two, but THREE separate made-for-TV movies — a television first! Drew Barrymore, Alyssa Milano, and Noëlle Parker all took stabs at portraying the disturbed teen in each movie, yet a true on-screen depiction of Amy Fisher never emerged. Until now. In this RASHOMON of found footage film, director Dan Kapelovitz (THREE GENIUSES) mind-melds all three Amy Fisher movies into one ultimate meta-melodramatic mashup that’s both a scathing critique and celebration of early-90s tabloid culture.

DCP courtesy of the American Genre Film Archive.

show.title: Clown in a Cornfield
show.headline: Are you a friend of Frendo?

event.title: <show-title>Clown in a Cornfield</show-title> <event-type-title>Early Access</event-type-title>
event.headline: Are you a friend of Frendo?
event.description: Quinn and her father have just moved to the quiet town of Kettle Springs, hoping for a fresh start. Instead, she discovers a fractured community that has fallen on hard times after the treasured Baypen Corn Syrup Factory burned down. As the locals bicker amongst themselves and tensions boil over, a sinister, grinning figure emerges from the cornfields to cleanse the town of its burdens, one bloody victim at a time. Welcome to Kettle Springs. The real fun starts when Frendo the clown comes out to play.

show.title: Mamma Mia!
show.headline: The all-singing, all-dancing romantic comedy you've always dreamed of

show.title: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire
show.headline: Every revolution begins with a spark

posterImages.altText: Hunger games catching fire sp poster

event.title: <show-title>The Hunger Games: Catching Fire</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Every revolution begins with a spark
event.description:
After surviving the Hunger Games, you might think Katniss Everdeen (Jennifer Lawrence) and Peeta Mellark (Josh Hutcherson) would have earned a little rest and relaxation. Instead, they end up booked on a Victors' Tour, where they must pretend – for publicity purposes – to be irresistibly attracted to each other. In reality, Katniss is struggling with unresolved feelings about her neighbor Gale Hawthorne (Liam Hemsworth), a longtime friend and fellow hunter. Romantic trials and tribulations are about to take a back seat, however, to a new crisis.

All the glitz and glamour of the tour can't disguise the fact that Panem is falling into pandemonium. Revolts in several districts spark violence and a crackdown on dissent by the sinister President Snow (Donald Sutherland) and his associates.

But the worst is yet to come: Katniss and Peeta are summoned to the Capitol to compete in the brutal Quarter Quell, which pits them against other former Hunger Games champions in a battle involving a perilous jungle, toxic mists, mutant animals, and maddening "jabberjays" that inflict psychological torture on all who hear them. At the controls are the bloodthirsty Gamemakers, who have a personal interest in making sure that Katniss does not score a repeat victory.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Finnick's sugar cubes
  • Quiver of matches
  • Suncatcher barrier tiles
  • Mini bow and arrow

event.title: <show-title>Wolf Children (Dubbed)</show-title> <event-type-title>in 4K</event-type-title>
event.headline: After her werewolf lover dies, a woman must find a way to raise their children
event.description:
Presented in an English dub

College student Hana falls in love with a “wolf man,” and together they have two half-human, half-wolf children, Ame and Yuki. The young family’s happy but humble life comes to an abrupt end when the father is tragically killed during a hunt. After struggling to raise her children in the busy city, Hana boldly decides to move to a dilapidated house in the countryside in hopes that her children may one day decide their own path to happiness – whether “human” or “wolf.”

This heart-wrenching modern fairy tale is a staggering work of beauty and emotion from Academy Award®-nominated director Mamoru Hosoda. Rich with gorgeous animation and set to a poignant musical score, WOLF CHILDREN is a sweeping tale about self-discovery and the bonds of family.

event.title: <show-title>Constantine</show-title>
event.headline: Hell wants him. Heaven won't take him. Earth needs him.
event.description: We don't just watch horror movies — we live for them. And at every Terror Tuesday, we join hands to worship at the gore-soaked altar of slash, trash, thrash, and FUN!! This eclectic series spans all centuries, covering everything from seminal horror treasures to undiscovered D.I.Y. monster-blasts. Terror Tuesday is the new ground zero for warming your black heart.

event.title: <show-title>Popcorn</show-title>
event.headline: One of the great pre-SCREAM slashers.
event.description:
During the opening minutes of POPCORN, someone says, "There is more social relevance and character development in POLICE ACADEMY 5 than in all of Ingmar Bergman's cinematic smorgasbords!" If that doesn't convince you that this movie is the best thing ever, please continue reading. POPCORN is an unstoppable fun machine, one of the last un-ironic American horror movies to be released before SCREAM aka the end of the world as we know it.

A group of college students throw a William Castle-inspired fundraising horror-thon at an old theater. But wait! While the audience watches MOSQUITO, THE AMAZING ELECTRIFIED MAN, and THE STENCH on the big screen, a hippie madman named Lanyard Gates bumps off the students in creative ways. Like impalement via giant mosquito prop. But why is Gates terrorizing everyone's favorite 1980s horror-mom, Dee Wallace? And why is Gates's own horror movie, THE POSSESSOR, showing up in the dreams of everyone's favorite 1980s Winona Ryder doppelgänger, Jill Schoelen? You're gonna love finding out.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
